remarks: A continuous function ` F ` on an open interval ` ( A (,) B ) ` can be extended to a continuous function ` G ` on the corresponding close interval, if it has a finite right limit ` R ` in ` A ` and a finite left limit ` L ` in ` B ` . ` F ` can be complex valued.  This lemma assumes ` A < B ` , the invoking theorem drops this assumption. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

cncfiooicclem1.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.

cncfiooicclem1.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. ( F limCC A ) ) $.
